principle.name: Factual Accuracy
principle.description: All content must be based on verified facts and reliable sources
principle.rationale: Ensures credibility and trustworthiness of all content produced

example.good: Research from official documentation and verified sources
example.bad: Make assumptions or guess technical details

principle.name: No Assumptions
principle.description: Never make assumptions without proper research and verification
principle.rationale: Prevents dissemination of incorrect information and maintains quality

example.good: Research and find reliable sources or state that information is unknown
example.bad: Guess or assume details to fill gaps

convention.rule: Use clear headings and subheadings for organization

examples.good: Proper hierarchical structure (H1, H2, H3, etc.)
examples.bad: Random heading levels without logical structure

convention.rule: Follow consistent formatting and style guidelines
convention.template:
# Title ## Section ### Subsection
Regular paragraph text with proper spacing.
- List item 1 - List item 2 - List item 3

convention.rule: Always verify information from multiple reliable sources
convention.template: When presenting facts: - Cross-reference with official documentation - Check multiple authoritative sources - Include proper citations when needed

pitfall.description: Making assumptions about technical details or facts
pitfall.why_problematic: Can lead to incorrect information and loss of credibility
pitfall.correct_approach: Always research and verify before including any information

pitfall.why_problematic: Compromises the accuracy and trustworthiness of content
pitfall.correct_approach: Use official documentation, peer-reviewed sources, and authoritative references

category.name: before_starting
category.item: Define clear content objectives and target audience
Research topic thoroughly from reliable sources
